physical_appearance:The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady. She is sitting down and facing sideways
 from the direction where the photograph was captured. Her hair is tied back and she is wearing an accessory on her head. She is dressed in her ethnic costume
 which is long sleeved and contains vertical and horizontal strips on the surface.

sgcool_label_text:This photograph shows the profile of a Chinese woman in Chinese dress and with an elaborate hairdo. \r\n\r\nStudios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s
 Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady. She is sitting down and facing sideways, from the direction where the photograph was captured. Her hair is tied back and she is wearing an accessory on her head. She is dressed in her ethnic costume, which is long sleeved and contains vertical and horizontal strips on the surface.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Women Ethnic costume
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows the profile of a Chinese woman in Chinese dress and with an elaborate hairdo. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
